    • Method Detail

      • getAllOrders

        List<Order> getAllOrders​(LocalDate date)
                  throws NoSuchOrderFileException
        Gets all orders based on the local date inputted in the format MMDDYYYY.The file format should be "Orders_MMDDYYYY.txt".
        Parameters:
        date - - utilised in getting all orders for that corresponding date.
        Returns:
        returns a list of all the orders for a particular date.
        Throws:
        NoSuchOrderFileException - - if the file cannot be found this exception is thrown.

      • addOrder

        Order addOrder​(Order newOrder)
        throws OrderPersistenceException
        Utilised to add an order to the respective date file.
        Parameters:
        newOrder - - The new order that needs to be added.
        Returns:
        returns the order, that has just been added
        Throws:
        OrderPersistenceException - - if the file it is written to doesn't open

      • exportOrders

        List<Order> exportOrders()
                  throws NoSuchOrderFileException,
                         OrderPersistenceException
        This will export all the active orders to the backup file
        Returns:
        - returns the active orders.
        Throws:
        NoSuchOrderFileException - - If the file cannot be found this exception will be thrown.
        OrderPersistenceException - - if it is unable to write to a field

      • getOrder

        Order getOrder​(LocalDate date,
               int orderNum)
        throws NoSuchOrderFileException,
               NoSuchOrderException
        Gets an order for the user
        Parameters:
        date - - requires the date that the order was made
        orderNum - - requires the order number to retrieve the file order
        Returns:
        the order, it it exists otherwise null.
        Throws:
        NoSuchOrderFileException - - this would occur if there is no such order file in existence.
        NoSuchOrderException - - this would occur if there is no order with that number

      • editOrder

        void editOrder​(Order orderToUpdate)
        throws NoSuchOrderFileException,
               OrderPersistenceException
        Updates an orders information based on the updated order which could be if a file is still active or if the file has updated details.
        Parameters:
        orderToUpdate -
        Throws:
        NoSuchOrderFileException - - this would occur if there is no such order file in existence.
        OrderPersistenceException - - if the file cannot be written to.
